-comment.-text: I've seen people argue, I thought persuasively, that special relativity could have been figured out, say, 20-30 years earlier, simply by following certain lines of thought. The root information and ideas were all there, they just needed to be extrapolated upon.

comment:
I've seen people argue, I thought persuasively, that special relativity could have been figured out, say, 20-30 years earlier, simply by following certain lines of thought.  The root information and ideas were all there, they just needed to be extrapolated upon.
"Choose Your Own Adventure" books, also known as "paragraph" books, could have arisen at pretty much any time in history with writing, and yet it was only after text adventures and such came out, and people got the idea to do it with paper.  Mark Twain wrote the first time travel story, in all of history.  Anybody could have done it!  Yet no religious text, no fiction before Mark Twain, featured time travel.

Perhaps AGI will figure out things that are just sitting out there to be found, already present there, "in the data."

comment: Interestingly, in the original Dune books, Frank Herbert talked about the danger of AGI in terms of the humans that used AGI instead of AGI itself.  The problem in his view was not that AGIs would take over the world but instead that AGI would allow power to concentrate on the few humans that control the technology.  That is way more scary to me, actually.

author: @tcbobb1613

comment: Everybody talks in terms of AI becoming conscious because, on one level, you could argue it is already intelligent. However, I would also argue that there may be many types of consciousness, and I would ask you to consider this: a cow is conscious but not necessarily intelligent in the way we think of intelligence as humans. If a cow was imbued with human-level intelligence, would its consciousness be the same as ours? An animal that is hardwired to love the herd, to be part of the herd, to live off the land, and not to be predatorial, to see strength in numbers. Would a cow’s consciousness, combined with intelligence, be the same as ours? In my opinion, no. So why would we assume that an intelligent machine that is not dependent on killing to survive and that has met its creator would have a consciousness that predisposed itself as ours does?
